Name: Cool Fruit Dip
Directions: 1.   Combine above ingredients until smooth
2. Serve with assorted fresh fruit such as whole strawberries, apple, peach, or pear wedges, etc.

Name: Guacamole
Directions: 1.   Combine above into a course paste (recommend using a mortar and pestle).
2.   Combine and mash the following: 2 large avacados, and 2T of finely minced cilantro
3.     Combine all together.  Season with salt to taste.  Garnish with small cilantro leaves, finely chopped white onion, and finely chopped tomatoes.  Makes about 2 cups.

Name: Oprah’s Deviled Eggs
Ingredients: 2 T. chopped parsley (plus extra for garnishing)
Directions: 1.     Hard boil eggs; cool; cut each in half lengthwise; remove yolks and place in medium mixing bowl.
2.     Add all other ingredients and mix well.
3.     Spoon mixture into egg whites and sprinkle with parsley and paprika.
4.     Cover and refrigerate at least an hour before serving.

Name: Salsa
Ingredients: 2 - 15 oz. cans petite diced tomatoes, drained and salted.
Directions: Combine all ingredients and chill before serving.

Name: Spinach Artichoke Dip  (Jessica Morrell)
Ingredients: 10 oz. bag spinach, thawed and drained
2 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese
Directions: 1.     Heat oven to 350º and grease baking dish.
2.     Mix ingredients, except for ½ cup cheese.
3.      Pour into prepared dish and top with ½ cup cheese.
4.      Bake ~ 15min.  Serve hot.

Name: Spinach-Feta Quesadillas
Ingredients: Fresh spinach leaves cut into thin strips
Olive oil (for sautéing the pepper, onion, and mushroom)
Directions: 1.     In a small pan, sauté peppers and onion; when ½ done, toss in mushrooms.
2.     In a large pan on medium heat, add small amount of olive oil, then a tortilla.
3.      Put ingredients from small pan onto tortilla; add feta and spinach, then top with another tortilla.

Name: Cajun Chicken Alfredo Pasta
Directions: 1.   Coat chicken with cajun seasoning and place in crockpot.
2.  Add rest of dry seasoning, diced peppers, and butter. Cover with heavy whipping cream.
Cook on high for about 3 1/ hours until chicken shreds easily.
3.  Add the pasta and cook for 25-30 minutes on low until pasta is done.

Name: BBQ Meatballs (from Grandmother’s 100th Birthday Party!)
Directions: 1.   Combine the following in a large bowl: ground beef, bread crumbs, minced onion, egg, salt and pepper.
2.   Form into small balls (about golf ball sized) and place into a baking dish.  At this point you can freeze them.
3.      For the sauce, combine the following: ¼ cup vinegar, ¾ cup brown sugar, 1 cup ketchup, 2 T. minced onion
4.     Pour sauce over meatballs and bake at 350 for I hour, covered.  You can transfer to a crockpot on “warm” if necessary.

Name: BBQ Meatballs (GAPS)
Directions: 1.     Combine the all ingredients in a very large bowl.

2.     Form into small balls (about golf ball sized) and place into a baking dish.  At this point you can freeze them (recommend using disposable tin pans for easy baking and cleanup, or separate layers with parchment paper to avoid sticking).
3.     Bake at 350° for I hour, covered.  If baking from frozen, allow 2+ hours to bake. Serve with your favorite BBQ sauce or ketchup, and a side of steamed veggies.

Name: Beef Crepes Continental – Naan’s
Directions: 1.   Cook all crepe ingredients on a crepe pan until dry looking or shiny.
2. Brown the beef, onion, salt, pepper, and mushroom. Add ½ cup of the sauce.
3.    Spoon 2 T beef filling into each, and roll.  Place them into a glass baking dish.  Sprinkle with ¼ cup parmesan cheese.  Pour remaining sauce over the crepes.  Bake 20 minutes at 375.

Name: Braised Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced.
1 T. oil from oil packed sun-dried tomatoes.
¼ cup drained, oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, thinly sliced (use scissors).
Directions: 1.     Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper.
2.     Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
3.      Add chicken and saute’ until golden (about 4 minutes per side).
4.      Add garlic and stir 30 seconds.
5.     Add white wine, cream, and tomatoes; bring to a boil.
6.      Cover skillet and reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until chicken is     cooked through (about 3 minutes); transfer chicken to a plate and set aside.
7.     Add basil to sauce in skillet; increase heat and boil until sauce thickens     enough to coat spoon (about 2 minutes); season with salt and pepper to taste.
8.      Return cooked chicken and cooked pasta to skillet and heat through; makes about 2 servings.

Name: Chicken and Corn Enchiladas
Directions: 1.     Lightly oil a large glass baking dish.
2.     Mix chicken, onions, corn, sour cream, cilantro, cumin, and 1 cup cheese in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper to taste.
3.     In a separate bowl, combine salsa and enchilada sauce.
4.     Heat a medium skillet over high heat; add 1 tortilla and cook until heated through (about 10 seconds on each side); remove and brush with sauce mixture.
5.     Spoon ~ 1/3 cup chicken filling into tortilla and roll; place seem side down in prepared dish.
6.     Preheat oven to 350º; spoon remaining sauce over enchiladas; sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese.
7.     Cover with foil and bake until heated through, about 35 minutes.

Name: Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: Red, green, and yellow bell peppers,
Directions: 1.      Cut boneless, skinless chicken breasts into small pieces, removing all fat.
2.     Preheat a large skillet to medium-high.
3.     Add a small amount of olive oil to hot pan and add chicken, stirring occasionally until chicken is all white.
4.     Add the following (to taste):
Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, green and red, Lime juice, Chili powder, Garlic powder, Salt , Fresh ground black pepper.
5.      Add veggies and continue cooking uncovered, stirring occasionally: Red, green, and yellow bell peppers, Yellow onion.
6.      When most of liquid has evaporated, add frozen corn and continue cooking until most liquid has evaporated (6-9 more minutes).
7.     Serve with warm tortillas, shredded cheddar cheese, and light sour cream.

Name: Chicken Macadamia
Directions: 1.     Marinate chicken in orange juice overnight.
2.     Combine, bread crumbs, 1 cup macadamia nuts, and salt in  a medium bowl; coat chicken well; place in baking dish.
3.     Combine butter and olive oil; drizzle over chicken.
4.      Generously pat additional macadamia nuts on top of each  piece of chicken. (May refrigerate or freeze at this point.).
5.      Bake at 375º for 20-25 minutes until browned on edges.

Name: Chicken (or ground beef) Parmesan Bake (GAPS)
Ingredients: 1 jar organic spaghetti sauce (I use Amy’s Organic,     Family Marinara).
Directions: 1.     In a buttered baking dish, cover the bottom with cooked spaghetti squash (I usually do this ahead of time and have in my freezer)
2.    Top the spaghetti with… Cooked, shredded chicken (or ground beef), 1 jar organic spaghetti sauce (I use Amy’s Organic,     Family Marinara), ½ cup-ish of parmesan cheese.
3.     Cover and bake at 350° for about 45-60 minutes.

Name: Chicken Pecan Quiche
Directions: 1.     Combine the following in a bowl and mix well: the flour, sharp cheddar cheese, pecans, the salt, and paprika.
2.     Stir in 1/3 cup vegetable oil.
3.     Reserve ¼ of the mixture and set aside.
4.     Press remaining mixture into the bottom and sides of a 9-inch quiche pan to form a crust (any baking dish will do); prick with a fork; bake at 350º for 10 minutes; allow to cool.
5.     Combine the following in a large bowl and mix well: 3 eggs, beaten, ½ cup chicken broth, 1 cup sour cream, ¼ cup mayonnaise.
6.      Stir in: 2 cups chicken, cooked and chopped fine, 3 drops Tabasco sauce, ½ cup cheddar cheese, shredded, ¼ cup onions, minced, ¼ t. dill, dried.
7.     Spoon mixture into the baked crust.
8.     Sprinkle with the reserved flour mixture and extra pecan pieces.
9.     Bake at 350º for 45 minutes or until set.

Name: Chinese Stir Fry
Ingredients: Lawry’s 30 Minute Marinade (Terriyaki with pineapple juice).
Your favorite vegetables, such as green peppers, onions, bean sprouts, water chestnuts, snow peas, broccoli, etc. (frozen vegetables will work too).
Directions: 1.     Cut up boneless skinless chicken breasts into bite sized pieces.
2.      Stir fry chicken in ~ 2 teaspoons olive oil until all white (pan should be preheated to medium-high).
3.     Add a generous amount of Lawry’s 30 Minute Marinade (Terriyaki with pineapple juice).
4.     Add your favorite vegetables, such as green peppers, onions, bean sprouts, water chestnuts, snow peas, broccoli, etc. (frozen vegetables will work); heat through.
5.      Add 1 can of chicken broth.
6.      Add 3 heaping T. cornstarch dissolved in 1 small glass of cold water.
7.      Return to boil; cook on medium heat until sauce thickens.
8.     Serve over crunchy Chinese noodles or rice, and garnish with scallions.

Name: Crunchy Dill Salmon
Ingredients: ½ t. fresh ground black pepper.
½ to 1 t. red pepper flakes.
Directions: 1.     Heat oven to 350º and line a baking sheet with foil; coat with cooking spray to prevent sticking.
2.     Combine onions, dill, and pepper in a zip-loc bag; crush and combine well.
3.     Combine mustard, honey, red pepper flakes, lemon juice and zest in a small bowl.
4.     Place salmon fillets (frozen or thawed) on baking sheet; brush with mustard mixture; coat with seasoned onion crumbs.
5.      Bake at 350º for 25 to 30 minutes or until opaque in center.
*Serve with steamed veggies and mashed potatoes.

Name: Grain-free Meatloaf
Directions: 1.   In a LARGE bowl, combine the following: 2 lbs. ground beef, ½ cup almond flour, 1-2 eggs, 1 T. minced onion, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 ½ tsp sea salt, 1 tsp black pepper.
2.   In a SMALL bowl, combine the following: ½ cup ketchup, 1 T. honey, 1 T. minced onion, 1 T. Worcestershire sauce.
3.  Combine ground beef mixture well and form into a loaf pan.  Pour sauce on top.
4.    .  Bake at 350 for about 1 hour.  Serve with steamed veggies and a grain-free dessert.

Name: Grilled Salmon Fillet Teriyaki
Ingredients: 2 T. + 2 t. naturally brewed soy sauce.
2 tsp finely chopped fresh ginger root.
Directions: 1.   Combine lemon juice and soy sauce in a small bowl.
2.     Gradually whisk in the oil.
3.     Stir in ginger, rosemary, cumin, garlic, and pepper.
4.     Marinade fillets ½ to 2 hours before grilling, with only ½ of the marinade; set aside remaining to use later.
5.      Preheat grill to medium-hot.
6.      Place the fillets on the grill skin side up and cook 6-7 minutes; turn over and cook 4-5 more minutes for slightly rare, or 6-8 more minutes for well done.
7.      Place the fillets on plates and spoon remaining marinade on top (this can be done just before removing from the grill).

Name: Hamburger, Cheese, and Ketchup
Directions: 1.     In a large skillet, cook 4-5 pounds of ground beef on medium heat.
2.    When most of the pink is gone from the ground beef, add 1 head of cauliflower, chopped or grated (optional).
3.     Cover and continue cooking and chopping the ground beef and cauliflower until both are thoroughly cooked.
4.     To serve, top with cheese and ketchup for the kiddos; also good with avocado and salsa, rice chips (not GAPS legal though), etc.  Can also be served with steamed veggies.

Name: Homemade Chicken Broth
Directions: 1.     In a large oven safe stockpot, place one (or more if your pan is large enough) whole chicken, organic, free-range.  It can be fresh or frozen.  When you’re making bone broth, it’s very important to use an organic chicken, as the nutrients and minerals from the bones will be in your broth.  Conventionally grown chickens will produce broth with hormones and chemicals.
2.    Add water to almost cover the chicken; or leave a good 2 inches from the top of the pan.
3.     Add 2-3 T apple cider vigegar, some organic unsalted butter, sea salt, and pepper.
4.     Bake at 225, covered, for 12-24 hours.  If cooking 2 or 3 chickens at a time, and/or from frozen, it takes longer.
5.      Remove from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 hours so it’s cool enough to handle.

6.      Peel apart, keeping the meat for meals later on.  (I chop and put in a large freezer Ziploc bag.  It breaks apart easily when frozen so you can use however much you need).  Save the rest of the chicken (bones, skin, everything….eww!) and set aside.
7.      Strain your broth using a fine strainer and refrigerate.

8.      Return the chicken bones, etc. to your stockpot.  Fill with water, up to about 2 inches from the top.  Add another 2-3 T. ACV, a good amount of sea salt and pepper.  Feel free to add onions, celery, garlic, etc. for flavor, but it’s not necessary.  Bake, covered, for 24-36 hours at 225.  Allow to cool for a couple hours and strain using a fine strainer.
9.      Combine chicken broth from the fridge, and bone broth together.  Once cooled, ladle into storage containers for the freezer.

Name: Lemon Chicken Stir-Fry
Ingredients: 1 t. fresh ginger root, finely chopped,
3-4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces,
2 pkgs. baked chicken flavor ramen noodles, broken into small pieces.
Directions: 1.     Chop ginger root; set aside.
2.      Cut broccoli and carrot; set aside.
3.      Cut bell peppers, green onions, and lemon zest; set aside.
4.     Squeeze and strain lemon juice; set aside.
5.     Cut chicken; set aside.
6.      Heat a large skillet to medium heat; stir-fry chicken (3-4 minutes).
7.     Add ginger root; stir-fry (30 seconds).
8.     Add water and bring to boil.
9.     Add ramen noodles and seasoning packets; bring to boil; reduce heat.
10.     Add broccoli and carrot; simmer 3 minutes or until most liquid is absorbed.
11.     Add bell pepper, green onions, and lemon zest; heat through.
12.     Drizzle with fresh lemon juice to taste; serve immediately.

Name: Lentil Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ¾ cup uncooked lentils, green or red,
½ cup uncooked long-grain brown rice,
¼ cup instant minced onion (or one small chopped onion),
Directions: 1.   Combine all ingredients in a casserole dish.
2.  Cover and bake for 2 – 2 ½ hours at 300º.
3.   During last 20 minutes of baking, top with ½ cup grated cheddar cheese.
4.   Just before serving, stir to blend in melted cheese.

Name: Margherita Pizza
Directions: 1.      Start with your favorite pizza crust (I  use Naan Bread) and brush lightly with olive oil.

2.     Add the following, in this order….. Fresh garlic, minced , Fresh mozzarella, sliced (or grated is fine too), Thinly sliced tomatoes, Fresh basil leaves, whole or torn, Little bit of sea salt and freshly  ground black pepper.
3.      Bake at 425° until cheese is light brown and crust is golden (about 8-9 minutes).

Name: Mom’s Enchiladas
Directions: 1.      Dried Ancho Chiles – Cut them open with scissors; remove seeds and stem.  Boil the chiles in water until they are soft…..about  30-40 minutes.
2.     In a blender, add……. boiled ancho chiles, 2 tsp. onion powder, 2 tsp. garlic powder, 1 tsp. cumin, water to pouring consistency.

3.     In a deep fat fryer, add about 2 inches of vegetable oil, and heat on high.  Dip tortillas in the ancho chile sauce, then into the hot oil.  Fry on each side, until the tortilla holds its shape a little.  (It will look like a wet rag if you remove it too early.) Place paper towels between tortillas to soak up extra oil.  You will want to do this step in a well-covered area, as the oil/sauce will splatter…….it’s best done outside or in the garage.
4.     For hamburger mixture…… Ground beef, Onion, Velveeta cheese.

For the Salsa……..puree the following in a blender: 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 can rotel, 2-3 cloves garlic, minced, ¼ red onion, cumin (a few shakes), 1 tsp. garlic powder , 1 tsp. onion powder, jalepenos (2 slices….or to taste).

Name: Mom’s Fried Chicken
Ingredients: ~ 3 T. Mrs. Dash Table Blend seasoning,
Directions: 1.     Thaw boneless, skinless chicken breasts (cut into strips) or tenderloins; cut off any visible fat.
2.     In a large Ziploc bag, combine: ~ ¾ cup flour, ~ 3 T. Mrs. Dash Table Blend seasoning.
3.     Preheat large skillet to medium.
4.     Add butter flavor Crisco, enough to cover bottom of pan.

5.     Dredge chicken in flour mixture and place in pan, turning 2-4     times as needed for browning. For tenderloins or strips, it will take ~ 15 minutes to cook; for whole chicken breasts, it will take closer to 30 minutes. Be careful not to burn the chicken, as this will ruin the gravy as well.
6.     When fully cooked, transfer to a stack of paper towels and immediately press to soak up grease (this is a very important step).
FOR GRAVY:
1.      Add flour to pan (amount of flour should equal amount of grease) and additional Mrs. Dash if needed for seasoning.
2.     Cook for a minute or two until brown, stirring constantly.
3.     Slowly whisk in milk and continue whisking constantly to prevent lumps from forming; cook to consistency.
4.     Add salt and pepper if needed to taste; serve with mashed potatoes.

Name: Naked Burgers
Directions: 1.  Season meat patty as you like. (I use organic worcestershire and fresh ground black pepper).
2.  Place a pat of organic unsalted butter on top.
3.  Grill as preferred, letting the butter melt into the burger before flipping.
4.  To serve…top with cheese (cheddar or pepper jack), slices of avocado, lettuce, and tomato; drizzle with olive oil (or homemade ranch); salt & pepper.

Name: Parmesan Chicken
Directions: 1.       Dip chicken in egg, then flour, then parmesan.
2.     In a frying pan with oil, brown both sides.
3.     Place chicken in a large glass baking dish.
4.      Cover with sliced onions, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella, and     parmesan.
5.     Bake at 350º for about 30 minutes.

Name: Pineapple Ham
Directions: 1.    Trim any visible fat from ham and place cut side down in a roasting pan.
2.    Pour enough milk over the ham so it is about ¼ inch deep in the pan.
3.    Using your hands, coat the ham with a generous portion of brown sugar.
4.    In the same manner, pack with drained pineapple.
5.    Cover with aluminum foil and refrigerate overnight.
6.    Preheat oven to 350°.  Bake, covered, for 30 minutes.
7.     Remove aluminum foil and baste with juices from the pan.
8.     Leave uncovered and continue baking another 30 minutes, or until ham is heated through.

Name: Ravioli Vegetable Stack
Directions: Layer the following in this order, and then repeat:
1.     Plum tomatoes, thinly sliced.
2.     Drizzle with olive oil
3.     Spinach, thinly sliced
4.     Fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced
5.      Zucchini and yellow squash, sliced lengthwise
6.      Red onion, thinly sliced
7.      Frozen meat-filled or cheese-filled ravioli
8.      Italian-blend shredded cheese
9.      Parmesan cheese
10.      Salt and pepper
Bake at 375°, uncovered for about 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
Hint: Do NOT serve to Cash! :)

Name: Herb Roasted Turkey Breast with Pan Gravy
Ingredients: 2 boneless turkey breast halves, skin and netting on (~ 2 to 2 ½ pounds each),
Salt and freshly ground black pepper.
¼ cup apple or regular brandy,
Directions: HERB PASTE:
1.    Add onion and lemon zest to food processor and chop until fine.
2.   Add sage leaves, parsley, olive oil, and salt; pulse until it forms a course paste.
BAY BUTTER:
1.    In a small sauce pan, heat butter and bay leaves over medium-low heat until butter is bubbling; remove from heat and set aside.
TURKEY:
1.    Preheat oven to 450º and oil a roasting pan.
2.  Carefully run fingers under the skin creating a pocket.
3.   Generously season with salt and pepper.  Spread herb paste evenly under skins.
4.    Transfer to roasting pan and slide 2 bay leaves under each one.  Baste each with bay butter.
5.   Place in oven and immediately decrease temperature to 400º.  After 20 minutes, baste with remaining bay butter and continue roasting for 20-25 minutes.
6.  A thermometer placed in the thickest part should register 170º.  Remove from oven and transfer to a platter.  Let rest 10 minutes before carving while making the gravy.
1.  Place roasting pan over burner on medium heat.
2.    Sprinkle flour over the pan juices and cook, stirring for a few minutes.  Add brandy and cook for a minute to burn off alcohol.
3.   While stirring, pour in apple cider.  Bring to simmer and stir until thickened.  Season with salt and pepper.
*To make extra gravy, add butter to pan juices, then extra flour.  For every tablespoon of butter, use 1 extra tablespoon flour.  Use chicken broth for liquid.

Name: Sloppy Joe Di Maggios
Ingredients: 1 T. steak seasoning (Montreal Steak Seasoning by     McCormick),
Directions: 1.   Brown the hamburger or turkey in a frying pan; add the onions and continue to cook 3-4 more minutes.
In a bowl, mix the: chili powder, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, and the steak seasoning.
3.   Add sauce to meat mixture and simmer a few minutes; serve over buns.

Name: Sopa Da Fidro
Ingredients: ½ pound vermicelli, broken into small pieces,
1 can petite diced tomatoes, not drained,
Directions: 1.      In a very large skillet, melt butter and sauté vermicelli until lightly browned.
2.     Stir in salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic, onion, celery, bell peppers, and corn.
3.     Add tomatoes and water; simmer 20-25min.
4.     Pour into large baking dish; cover with sliced cheese.
5.     Bake at 350º until cheese is melted and heated through (10-15min.).

Name: Souper Potato Pie
Ingredients: 1/2 of a can of cream of mushroom soup
Directions: Mix the following and spread into a 9-inch pie pan: 1/2 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 pound hamburger (uncooked and thawed), ¼ onion, 1 egg, slightly beaten, ¼ cup dried bread crumbs, ½ teaspoon salt, Dash pepper.
Bake the above mixture at 350º for 25 minutes then drain.
Top with: 2 cups mashed potatoes, ½ cup shredded cheese and the rest of mushroom, soup (combined).
Continue baking at 350º for another 15-20 minutes.

Name: Sour Cream Chicken
Directions: 1.   Combine flour with sour cream.
2. 	Add and whisk mushroom soup, white wine, pepper, and garlic salt.
3. 	Place chicken in a large glass baking dish and pour mixture over them.
4.  	Bake at 350º for 1 ½ hours.

Name: Spicy Baked Chicken
Ingredients: 6 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (trim all fat)
Directions: 1. 	Heat oven to 425º and lightly grease a 13x9 baking dish.
2. 	In a small pan, sauté garlic in butter.
3. 	Combine bread crumbs, parsley, salt, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and onion powder; set aside ~ ½ cup to use later.
4. 	Dredge chicken in garlic butter, then in bread crumb mixture.
5.	Arrange in the prepared pan; drizzle with remaining garlic butter; sprinkle with additional bread crumb mixture.
6. 	Bake uncovered for 35 minutes until golden brown; serve immediately.

Name: Spinach and Goat Cheese Pizza
Directions: 1.  	Start with your favorite pizza crust (I use Naan Bread) and brush lightly with olive oil.
2. 	Preheat a skillet to low;  sauté red onion, in about a tablespoon olive oil, until caramelized (about 5-6 minutes); add thinly shredded spinach and continue to sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
3. 	Spread the onion and spinach mixture evenly over prepared crust.
4. 	Top with crumbled goat cheese.

Directions.Name: Steak Au Poivre
Ingredients: 4 (3/4 to 1 inch thick) boneless top-loin or filet steaks (8 to 10 oz each)
½ stick butter, cut into 4 pieces
½ cup Cognac or other brandy
Directions: 1. 	Preheat oven to 200º.
2. 	Pat steaks dry and season both sides with salt and ground pepper.
3.  	Heat a heavy non-stick skillet to medium-high and add oil.
4. 	Saute’ steaks in 2 batches, turning once, about 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
5.  	Transfer steaks to a glass baking dish and keep warm in the oven while making sauce.
6.  	Pour grease from skillet; add shallots and half of the butter (2 T.) and cook over moderately low heat, stirring until well-browned (3-5 minutes).
7.  	Add Cognac (careful, it may ignite) and boil, stirring until liquid is reduced to a glaze (2-3 minutes).
8. 	Add cream, stirring occasionally until reduced by half (3-5minutes).

Directions.Name: Mom’s Famous Taco Shells
Directions: 1. 	Combine: the flour, the baking powder, and the salt.
2. 	Add water to make a very stiff dough (use hands to mix).
3. 	Pinch off small amounts of dough, ~ 1-2 inches in diameter.
4.  	Roll out (or use a pastry roller) until very thin.
5. 	Fry in a ~ ¼ inch of oil until golden brown.
*This recipe will only make 4-6 shells.

Name: Turkey Burgers with Cranberry Bog
Ingredients: 1 cup prepared whole berry cranberry sauce
Directions: 1:  Combine the following into a bowl and form into patties: Turkey Burgers with Cranberry Bog, the apple, the onion, the celery, the poultry seasoning, and the salt and pepper.
Preheat a large skillet or grill pan to med-high heat; drizzle with olive oil; cook 5-6 minutes on each side.  (Can be grilled also)
FOR THE CRANBERRY BOG:
Combine the following in a small bowl: 1 cup prepared whole berry cranberry sauce, ½ cup light mayonnaise
*Serve turkey burgers on toasted English muffins; top with cranberry bog and leaf lettuce*
